item.title: Faded white line markings, 8th April
item.description:
Elmbridge court roundabout white markings are barely visible and is currently dangerous as is a high speed roundabout with plenty of confusion of other drivers There are regular accidents on this roundabout and believe the lack of white markings contributes to this issue
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmbridge Court Roundabout, Elmbridge, Gloucester

item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Disabled access non-existent, 8th April
item.description:
Luke lane public footpath which provides access to Pirton fields has a high curb so wheelchairs cannot access and have to take a long detour. Curb should be dropped. Please advise how this will be made accessible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mottershead Drive, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole making roundabout impassable, 8th April
item.description:
Located on the roundabout. The pothole is so large and deep that it’s like driving in a 3rd world country. The council continues to ignore this area for repair
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Cheltenham Road, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large sinkhole, previously repaired, worsening rapidly, 8th April
item.description:
There is a large sinkhole appearing outside Sainsburys. It was filled in a while ago but the underlying issue not fixed. The overnight closures on A417 mean that a huge number of HGVs are thundering over it making it deteriorate rapidly. Earlier I witnessed an HGV carrying a 40ft shipping container almost lose control (it was travelling too fast). If the sinkhole caves-in and an HGV comes off the road it could cause fatalities in this built up area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 70, Cirencester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New sign stating No Private Land No Public Access causing confusion., 8th April
item.description:
Greenfield Farm Little Shurdington Shurdington CHELTENHAM GL51 4TX. Following the yellow 'Gloucestershire Way' Signs on pathway ABA94, (USRN 40103062): leaving Greenfields Farm you are directed through a gate approximately 20m from the farmyard which has recently been repaired. [What3Words location, regaining.trucked,unsigned].There are now signs on the gate stating that it is private land and there is no public access. This sign did not use to be there. This is confusing as it conflicts with the signs indicating the route of the pathway. The situation is not made any clearer by looking on the map as this small section of path is missing on your official map even though signage has been posted along the route to indicate the path. The consequence of complying with this sign is that there is no clear access to the route between Greenfield Farm and Slad Road/the top of Crickley hill. In fact, when you come the opposite way you reach within 20m of Greenfield Farm and then informed that there is no further access and you have to go back up the hill to Slad Road where you started. Can you please clarify the route to be taken when leaving Greenfield Farm and adjust the signage to suit?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenway Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 8th April
item.description:
28 day with 3 way stop and go plus temporary footway closure needed please cut back overgrown brambles growing out into footway back to boundary appropriately 12 meters x1 meters (Overgrown Hedge)
Report on FixMyStreet
